text: Shout outs also due to @mySociety @steiny et al for pushing the idea of e-petitions as an idea in the first place.....
author: jamescrabtree

text:
"If Facebook and its rivals are perceived to stumble in India and Indonesia they now face a double risk: new restrictions targeting their role in politics as well as nationalist-inspired measures aimed at them more generally."

https://asia.nikkei.com/Opinion/Facebook-and-rivals-face-critical-test-in-Asian-elections2 …
author: jamescrabtree

text: always a good time to read about them, no?
author: jamescrabtree

text: thanks for this. Brightened my morning. I enjoyed writing that chapter too. The literature on corruption is fascinating, although obviously the tradecraft is even more so.
author: jamescrabtree

text:
Hard to overstate what a major test the upcoming elections in India, Indonesia et al are for the big social media giants, and Facebook / WhatsApp in particular. Also hard to imagine they are well prepared — My latest in @NAR 
https://asia.nikkei.com/Opinion/Facebook-and-rivals-face-critical-test-in-Asian-elections2 …
author: jamescrabtree

text: This trip back in time to 10-year-old Twitter feature is delightfully calming. Bring back people telling us about dinner plans and subway misfortunes.
author: jamescrabtree

text:
"Cat Ladders of Switzerland". 

Finally, a template that show the innovation Britain may be capable of when it escapes the stultifying constraints of Brussels. (h/t @benedictevans)

http://brigitteschuster.com/swiss-cat-ladders?utm_source=Benedict%27s+newsletter&utm_campaign=d2b7126611-Benedict%27s+Newsletter_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4999ca107f-d2b7126611-70393137 …
author: jamescrabtree

text: the problem (cf this in @NAR) is Trump's alliances approach. Huawei kit is cheap & useful. Foreign spooks think security risks are manageable. So why should US allies take one for the team, if they  expect Trump will then stiff them on some other thing?
author: jamescrabtree

text:
Alarming line in NYT analysis on America's unsuccessful anti-Huawei drive. If US targets Huawei directly, the risk is China respons in kind, potentially targeting formal or informal restrictions on the supply chains of companies like Apple. 

https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/17/us/politics/huawei-ban.html …
author: jamescrabtree

text: that's very kind of you Danielle. Exploring other writing projects, but no India follow-up in mind at the moment. Much appreciate you dropping me a line and hope you, the elephant, the tiger, the bee and the bird enjoy the rest of it......
author: jamescrabtree

text: Long may that confine. Britain's system has big residual strengths. Institutional Renewal is possible too. I would like to agree with your notion that this is a democratic system working exactly it should, but it's hard to see what's happening as the road to a new consensus.
author: jamescrabtree

text: A fair point. In a strange way I imagine the fiasco of the last 6 months must have left both sides equally dispirited, uniting davos and grimsby in one giant social unifying
author: jamescrabtree

text: Well, it's the average leave voter that got us into this mess....
author: jamescrabtree

text: Yesterday ran into a senior Singaporean think tanker. She was heading to London at the end of the month & seemed genuinely worried there might be brexit riots & she'd not be able to go. Hard to underestimate the damage this is doing to Britain's reputation for basic competence.
author: jamescrabtree

text: This is a fine piece on Britain's broken constitution - "a generation of MPs doesn’t know where the default setting is. They see the role of a backbench MP not as an extra, but a protagonist. They have been radicalised."
author: jamescrabtree
